intro: Asclepias phenax, commonly known as the showy milkweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, upright stems that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers with distinctive, hood-like structures called galeae.
